dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hell, I can't remember. Prob'bly see him again though. Tell you what. You leave the money with me, I'll see he gets it... as a favor to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have to talk to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whatsa matter? You don't trust me? I'll have you know I used to be a college professor. We can work together.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure. Keep the bottle. I'll be back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "Long life to the grape! For when summer is flown, The age of our nectar Shall gladden our own." That's Shelley, you know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Clifford is "suiting up" for his night's work. He is dressed casually -- blue jeans, shirt open at the neck, sports jacket, Adidas running shoes. He looks at himself in the mirror, is satisfied. Then he picks up from the dresser two awl-like instruments with short handles and long, glistening tapered needlepoints -- his weapons. He slides them into a leather sheath inside his jacket and turns to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is lit up inside. The bar is open for business. Across the street in a dark space between two buildings, Duncan is waiting, watching the front door of the bar to see who comes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The place is empty but for Hank who half watches the television over the bar, and Tracy who sits alone in a corner. Several moments pass as both of them sit and wait. Then, the front door starts to swing open. Someone is coming in. Tracy and Hank both glance nervously toward the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: head peeks in. He is somewhere in his forties, a regular customer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The customer walks up to the bar, sits down and talks quietly with Hank. Tracy looks nervously at her wristwatch. She stubs out her cigarette, takes one last gulp of her drink and stands up to go. She walks to the bar, opens her purse and reaches inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They exchange a meaningful look. Then she heads for the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Hank, what're you doing open tonight?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (relaxing) Trying to make a buck.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Keep it, honey. My treat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (under his breath) That how you make a buck?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Tracy looks up and down the street, hoping to see Clifford somewhere, afraid of glimpsing Duncan instead. Then she starts walking quickly homeward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Following Tracy to her apartment. We pick up Clifford now, and we cut back and forth between the two of them -- her walking quickly, never looking back, and him sneaking along several hundred feet behind her, looking everywhere for Duncan, whom we never see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She walks up the steps and enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tracy steps off the elevator and goes to her door. She fumbles through her purse for the key. Then she hears footsteps on the stairs. She turns. It's Clifford.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tracy shakes her head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She is starting to come apart, and she suddenly leans on Clifford for support.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tracy stands there for several seconds to regain control of herself. Then she steps away and turns back to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tracy gets the door unlocked. She pushes it open.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (coming forward: half- whispering) No luck. You see him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He still could be out there, though.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softly) Oh, God...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to hang around outside for awhile. I'll be back on and off again all night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Tracy steps in. Clifford stays in the doorway. They are still whispering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tracy closes the door and throws the bolt. Then she walks into the apartment and out of frame. CAMERA STAYS in the hallway. We can hear Tracy moving about O.S. Then, as if on its own, the door to the hall closet slowly swings open... ...until we can see Duncan standing inside the closet.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Are you sure you're okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right. Bolt your door. Don't let anybody in, no matter what.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll be seeing you. (starts to move off; comes back) Listen. Thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Tracy is putting some coffee on. Then she removes her coat and walks out of the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tracy goes up to the closet with her coat. The door is closed. She opens it. She hangs up her coat and closes the door again. Then she turns and starts walking out of the hallway to the living room. As she is rounding the corner into the living room, she walks right into Duncan. She barely has time to gasp before he clamps his hand over her mouth and pushes her against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As she isn't struggling, he starts to loosen up on her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes his hand away from her mouth, lets go of her, and slowly, cautiously steps back. Tracy looks at him for a breathless moment, her eyes wild with fear. Then she screams. Duncan jumps back, stunned, frightened and confused. Tracy doesn't move. She just keeps screaming hysterically.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (urgent whisper) I just have to talk to you. (pathetically) I want you to be my friend.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Tracy's screams carry out into the night as Clifford races across the street and into the apartment building.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duncan runs to a window, throws it open and climbs out onto the fire escape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Clifford bounds up the stairs, flight after flight, and Duncan tears down the fire escape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The screaming has stopped when Clifford reaches Tracy's door. He grabs the doorknob and heaves himself against the door. It's bolted shut. Clifford pulls one of the needles from his jacket and hammers it into the lock. The bolt springs and Clifford runs into the apartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Clifford bursts in. Tracy gestures toward the window. Clifford runs to it and sticks his head out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duncan is gone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clifford runs to a window on another wall and looks out onto the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No sign of the Englishman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clifford runs out of the apartment, yanking his needle from the lock as he passes the door, and charges back down the stairs. Tracy moves to the door and closes it. She is breathing heavily. O.S. we hear the angry sizzle of coffee spilling onto the hot stove, as Tracy goes to get it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clifford comes out, looks around and moves rapidly up the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duncan is hurrying along, dodging in and out of people, trying to move quickly but not draw attention to himself...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clifford is travelling along the sidewalk, crossing the street, looking everywhere...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duncan is running up the alley. He comes to a stop beside some piled up trash cans. He leans against the brick wall of the building, huffing and puffing. He is frightened, but he feels safe for now. He slowly slides down the wall to the ground...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duncan is curled up in the corner of a bare cell with padded walls. He is in a strait-jacket. His head is shaved. We can't tell what he is thinking, except that he's obviously deeply frightened and cannot understand what's happening to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the children's bedroom in Dr. Mandrakis' house of six years ago. It is dark. Two small beds occupy one corner of the room. We can see two small lumps on the beds, but no more. Duncan sits in the foreground with a telephone on his lap. He is dialing a number. The phone rings three times before it is answered -- or rather, picked up, because there is no voice on the other end. After several seconds the phone is hung up. Duncan hangs up and thinks for a moment. He picks up the phone and dials again. This time he gets a busy signal. He hangs up, stands and goes to the door. He opens it slowly, peers out. Jill's voice can be heard faintly talking to the operator, asking for the police. Duncan closes the door and comes back into the room, mumbling. He goes to the window, looks out. Then he goes to the children's beds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he raises the covers and stares down into the CAMERA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A freighter, broad and low, arduously cuts through the water. Early morning mist hangs over the deck which is empty but for a lone FIGURE standing on the prow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is Curt Duncan. He is looking out over the front of the ship. Another SEAMAN comes up behind him and claps him on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duncan moves away, wanting to be left alone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He walks away laughing.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: So this will be your first time? (laughs) An old salt like you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (still laughing; slightly punchy) You'll love it here. It's where they make the bombs. It's where they make the planes that carry the bombs; the planes we saw over Singapore and Manila.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There she is. That's America.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The coast of Southern California emerges through the mist. A foghorn blows somewhere in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -UP - DUNCAN As he peers ahead with inscrutable interest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dark. A little BOY is lying in bed, apparently asleep. This is Curt Duncan as a child. Some voices approach in the hallway outside the bedroom. They are gruff, with heavy English accents, but subdued; a MAN and a WOMAN, well into middle-age. The boy's eyes open as he listens:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From outside, a key enters the lock of the bedroom door and turns. The bolt slips and the door is securely shut. The boy sits up in bed, apprehensive. In TIGHT SHOTS of the floor we see a rat come out from under the bed, then another. They make "chit-chit" noises as they begin to explore. One of them maybe goes up on its hind legs and nibbles on the bedpost. Then we see two more rats appear. We go for a TIGHT SHOT of the boy on top of the bed. The "chit-chit" noises grow steadily louder as the boy's apprehension turns to fear, then to terror. The boy starts to whimper. Suddenly, we cut back to a WIDE SHOT of the room. The floor is crawling with rats, hundreds of them. The "chit-chit" rises to practically a roar as the boy, alone on top of the bed, begins to wail. The room seems to darken, and the boy becomes just a little white speck in it. The focus is turned. The picture becomes a black and white blur.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) What's the matter?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Save it for later. Let's go out and get some food.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) What about the lad? You can't leave him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Curt's asleep. He'll never know we're gone.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: NIGHT - THE PRESENT At first all that can be seen is a white blur against a black screen. The previous sound of a boy crying increases. Then the blur grows larger, coming more into focus as the entire screen image moves toward normal definition. Finally, we know we are back in the alleyway, that it is night, and that the white blur is actually a little BOY lost, sobbing uncontrollably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Awakening to the scene, coming back to reality. He is confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE ON DUNCAN AND BOY The boy continues sobbing, moving about in little circles. Duncan, amazed at what he sees, slowly crawls out from the wall on his hands and knees, crawls toward the weeping child, staring at it with a strange look on his face. Suddenly the boy stops crying and looks at Duncan quizzically, hesitantly. They are less than a foot apart, almost face to face. Together they form a kind of frozen tableau. Something close to sympathy crosses the killer's expression, and the boy, likewise, achieves a faint sense of recognition. Then, just as suddenly, the boy starts wailing again and he runs off down the alleyway. Duncan watches him disappear. Then he slowly pulls himself to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clifford is coming up the sidewalk. As Clifford crosses the entrance to an alleyway, the boy comes running out and almost collides with him. Clifford grabs the boy and looks down at him. Then he passes the wailing child off on a nearby PEDESTRIAN and runs up into the alley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duncan is hurrying along the sidewalk. Something makes him look up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is looking at a neon "Jesus Saves" sign above the doorway to an inner city mission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he stares at the sign.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duncan turns to see Cheater elatedly hobbling up to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duncan pulls his arm free.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duncan pulls free again and heads toward the mission.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duncan enters the mission and Cheater stands out on the sidewalk for a moment, bitterly frustrated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Several PEDESTRIANS stop and gape at this sudden outburst.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Hey, Crazy Curt!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hail fellow well met, and all that jazz. It's our lucky day! (taking Duncan by the arm) A friend of your's got money for you. We got to get back to the park and meet him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: C'mon. He'll be comin' for you, Crazy Curt. S'got some money. (reaching for Duncan's arm) We'll get us a little joy juice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: C'mon! Hey!! You really are crazy! C'mon!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: "Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! Rage! Blow, you cataracts and hurricanoes, spout till you have drench'd our steeples and drown'd the cocks!"
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Clifford comes out of a derelict hotel, looks up and down the street and hurries off, not giving up the chase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is leading Duncan to the bathroom. Duncan enters slowly and goes to one of the wash basins where there is an old razor blade and a can of shaving cream. Duncan picks up the razor for a moment and looks at it. He is lost in thought. Then he sets it down and turns on the tap water. He glances at himself in the mirror and is suddenly transfixed by his own image. He looks deeply into the mirror for several seconds. Then he starts to cry, and having begun, a flood of emotions comes pouring out of him. He drops to his knees. The man comes running back into the bathroom. He holds Duncan and helps pull him back to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cheater is trudging along the sidewalk, hands in pockets, head lowered. He looks up and sees something that brings him back to life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clifford is standing on the corner up ahead, looking around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cheater calls out and starts to run toward Clifford. Clifford turns, sees Cheater.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The "sleeping dorm". It is a large empty room. Thirty or so OUTCASTS are stretched out on the bare floor in the darkness. Their combined snoring/wheezing creates a steady, ghastly din. The door at the far end of the hall opens. A figure steps in and quietly closes the door behind him. He stands for a moment taking in the scene, letting his eyes adjust to the darkness. Then he slowly creeps forward to the prone body of the nearest sleeper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is Clifford. He moves stealthily from one body to the next. In one hand he carries a small flashlight. He turns the bodies over just long enough to shine the light in their faces and identify who they are, or rather who they are not. Then he moves on. In his other hand he holds a small, gleaming Jimmy needle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's sleeping, but his eyes suddenly open, sensing danger. He turns over and sees the dark figure of Clifford slowly advancing toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE Clifford keeps coming, closer and closer to where Duncan lies. He is but six or seven bodies away when Duncan jumps up suddenly and bolts for the door. Clifford looks up, sees the fleeing figure and charges after it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Racing through a maze of narrow hallways, Duncan can't stop to think where he's going. Clifford is barreling after him some forty yards behind. Duncan rounds a corner and ten yards up ahead, the hallway deadends in a set of double doors. Duncan has no choice but to hurl himself against the doors. They yield and he goes through them. Four seconds later, Clifford comes to the same doors and pushes through to the other side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Clifford comes through the doors which are a side entrance into the chancel of this large, gothic-style church. Behind him now, is the altar. Before him stretches the nave of the edifice with its rows of pews, its dimly glowing stained glass windows, and way in the back, its choir loft. At regular intervals, tiny shafts of light pierce the darkness from on high. There is no sign of Duncan, but Clifford knows he must be in here, hiding somewhere. He slowly walks forward to the front of the chancel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pause. Duncan doesn't come out. Clifford holds very still. He hears nothing. He speaks again and his voice echoes through the large empty church.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Duncan. Duncan. It's over now. Come on out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My name's John Clifford. I'm a private detective. I've been hired by Alexander Mandrakis to take you back. I'm not going to hurt you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hiding beneath a pew. He hears the name "Mandrakis" and it registers like a thunderbolt. He silently mouths the name "Mandrakis". Then he hears Clifford's footsteps approaching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slowly moving up the center aisle, looking from side to side into the pews.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clifford moves closer and closer to Duncan's row until finally, Duncan can bear it no longer. He jumps up from beneath the pew and runs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clifford chases him through the pews and up the aisles to the front of the church. He is clutching a needle in both hands, ready to strike. Duncan flees through a narrow door off to the side of the church.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (gently; coaxing) I'm not going to hurt you... I'm not going to hurt you... There'll be no more pain... You're safe now...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hysterical) No! Mandrakis! No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Duncan faces a spiraling stone staircase. He has no choice but to climb them, higher and higher, the sound of Clifford's angry footsteps always coming up behind him. Finally, Duncan can climb no higher. He is at the top of the bell tower. A lanceted opening in the stone wall ahead of him looks out over the narrow shaft of the tower. Above him are the huge iron bells. A rope hangs down from the bells, dangling all the way down the shaft, forty or fifty feet to the floor of the church. Clifford is bounding up the last flight of steps to get him. Duncan has little choice. He is trapped. Just before Clifford reaches him, Duncan leaps out into the shaft and catches the bell rope. The bell starts to clang as Duncan, hanging in mid air, swings back and forth within the narrow shaft. Clifford leans way out through the lancet window and takes a swipe at Duncan, but the madman is just beyond his reach and hurriedly climbing down the rope. Clifford reaches out and tries to grab at the rope. At last, he gets it, and he shakes it violently to get Duncan to lose his grip and be dashed against the stone floor below. But Duncan holds firm, climbing ever downward. The bell continues to clang, sending its alarm out into the night. Then Clifford braces himself and slowly, laboriously begins to haul up on the rope. Clifford gains momentum until Duncan is being pulled up faster than he is climbing down. Still twenty feet off the ground, Duncan lets go of the rope and plummets to the hard stone floor. Then PEOPLE come rushing into the church, awakened by the commotion of the bells. Duncan rolls into the shadows and drags himself out a side door, while Clifford plans his own escape from the bell tower.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clifford runs up the alleyway, looks around and finally realizes he's lost his prey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Duncan is hidden deep in the shadows of a nook between two buildings, catching his breath. CAMERA MOVES IN on him, and we see him looking the craziest he's ever been. He shakes uncontrollably and begins to mumble, softly at first, then getting louder. He's falling back into the grips of Guy du Marraux.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . All is still and quiet as soft, warm sunlight pours into the dirty streets and alleyways. In the background, the bell tower of the church rises above the skyline. B. We see a SHOT of the park -- all the bums are asleep. C. Then a SHOT of the mission -- its front door open, the sidewalk empty. D. Then the bar, where the same peaceful mood prevails. E. Then the alleyway where we last saw Curt Duncan. Now he is gone. F. Then the exterior of Tracy's apartment building. Clifford's car is parked out front.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I used to see my two kids every weekend. They lived in a nice house with their father, outside the city.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Tracy and Clifford are sitting at a small table in the kitchen, looking haggard, drinking coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look at each other. Clifford is a sympathetic listener.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Taking his cue, Clifford slowly rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tracy looks up at him questioningly, wishing she could feel as sure about it as he does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tracy takes his hand. They shake warmly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clifford turns back to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clifford smiles at her gently. He knows exactly what she means.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clifford takes a few steps, turns back, looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clifford nods his head slightly, as if registering this in his memory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They smile at each other for a second then Clifford leaves and Tracy sits alone in her kitchen, listening to him go, hearing the door close behind him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Now... it's been years. They're grown up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I look at where I am now. I know I could've done better, but... it's too late for that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, you've got to keep looking, I suppose.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think he'll come back here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (extending his hand) Thanks... for all your help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know it wasn't easy. (turning to go) Maybe, someday, I'll be able to...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wish you wouldn't leave me altogether...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (with a laugh) I'm not a young woman anymore. I've given up all my dreams of the future. Now, I just want to make it to the end. You know what I mean.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll be around.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You like ice cream?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What flavor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Chocolate chip.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly) Okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: UP on a section of a newspaper lying in the gutter. A pair of feet enters the frame and stands beside the newspaper. We hear a familiar cough. Then a trembling hand reaches down and picks up the newspaper. Pause. Something in the newspaper has caught his eye. Then the feet shuffle out of frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A modest middle-income neighborhood where young married couples buy their first home and start their family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is facing down the quiet street. In the foreground, on the street, two small CHILDREN, a little boy and a little girl, are playing. They are adorable kids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S ninety degrees with the children as they run out of the street and up the sidewalk to their house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: across the bottom of the screen: 5 pm Friday, April 28, 1978 TITLE FADES as the children push open the front door and enter the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They noisily and excitedly make their way to the kitchen. The children are four and two and a half years old, STEVIE and JUNE respectively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the kids enter, their MOTHER is working at the stove, her back to CAMERA.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The mother turns around. It is Jill Johnson!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: & STEVIE (together) Hi, Mommy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) Well, look what the wind blew in!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: on her as she comes forward, bends down, kisses Stevie, and picks up June. Jill looks older, more mature, but still very pretty. She is Mrs. John Lockhart now, and has left her memories of the past behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A wall phone in the kitchen starts to ring. Stevie goes to answer it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is JOHN LOCKHART on the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jill, by this time, has come to the phone. She is still holding June.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stevie hands the phone to Jill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jill is very happy about this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Jill hangs up the phone, Stevie pipes up O.S.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mommy, what's for dinner? Could we have hamburgers?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (teasing) Is that all you ever want?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (surprised) Hey, how's my little tiger?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Daddy, Junie threw my baseball down the street; and I can't find it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Well, we'll look for it real hard later. Let me talk to mommy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay. Bye, daddy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hi.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hi, babe -- whaddya say you put on a sexy dress, and I take you out to dinner tonight?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Great... what's the occasion?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (teasing) Just a little surprise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm leaving here now; be home in half an hour.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, see ya.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Bye, babe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Mommy, is Daddy gonna get me a new baseball?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . MANDRAKIS' HOUSE - NIGHT Clifford's car is parked in the driveway, and we see him getting out. He goes to the front door -- the porch light is on and perhaps one other lamp somewhere inside the otherwise dark house. He rings the bell, waits, rings again... Finally the door is opened by the Houseboy.

direction.raw_text: Clifford takes a business card from his pocket and gives it to the Houseboy.

dialogue.raw_text: Dr. and Mrs. Mandrakis are out of town.

(beat) Here's the number of the restaurant. Call us if you need us. For police, ambulance, any emergency like that, just dial 911. You know that, right?

dialogue.raw_text: Goodbye.

dialogue.raw_text: Goodbye.

dialogue.raw_text: (disappointed) Ohhh...

direction.raw_text: An Italian Restaurant. Quiet music, soft lights, red and white checkered tablecloths, candles, a smokey and seductive atmosphere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: with a LATIN WAITER carrying a huge tray of food over- head. He passes right by the table where Jill and John are sitting. John watches him take the food to someone else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The WAITER arrives with their food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The waiter looks up, offended.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They ignore him. He moves away. John digs right in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John leans forward and whispers in her ear.

direction.raw_text: John pauses, looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The MAITRE D' has come up to the table. John stops suddenly. They are both very chagrined.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John starts to get up. Jill grabs his arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jill stands up and follows the Maitre D' through the other tables to the telephone. She picks up the receiver. CAMERA MOVES in on her.

direction.raw_text: Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jill screams and falls to the floor.

dialogue.raw_text: (reaching for a breadstick) I've eaten enough breadsticks to turn into a pretzel.

dialogue.raw_text: John, tell me about the surprise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, yeah. Brace yourself.

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, sure.

dialogue.raw_text: No, I don't believe you.

dialogue.raw_text: Enjoy your dinner, folks.

dialogue.raw_text: A lot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How much?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And a car.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: John, I'm so proud of you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the matter? You don't like your food?

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. and Mrs. Lockhart?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's right.

dialogue.raw_text: Hello?

direction.raw_text: Around him, other DINERS fall instantly silent and wonder what is going on. WAITERS stop dead in their tracks. John leaps up from his seat and dashes through the tables like a madman. Suddenly the restaurant comes alive with excitement and alarm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As John runs up and drops to his knees beside her. She is shaking and sobbing uncontrollably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Other PEOPLE have crowded around and are making urgent noises now about calling the police, an ambulance, etc. John tries to cut through the confusion and anxiety.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jill nods. John grabs the telephone and quickly dials a number. The crowd tries to quiet down, as much to hear for themselves as to let John talk. The phone rings and rings. Finally...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Long pause. They wait for her answer. Jill is listening into the receiver now, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jill is confused. John breathes a guarded sigh of relief. Jill takes the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jill gives her husband a look. John takes the phone again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jill is violently shaking her head. John silences her with a gesture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carol O.S. puts the phone down. Then there is silence on the other end. The crowd of people around Jill and John begin to shuffle and murmur. John tries to keep them quiet while listening into the phone. Then TWO POLICEMEN come forward through the crowd. One of them kneels down to John and Jill who are still on the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This means nothing to Policeman #1.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Policeman #2 kneels down now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the two policemen and John mumble between themselves, Jill takes the telephone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She presses the receiver tighter to her ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: John quiets down the policeman. Jill can now hear what she couldn't a second ago.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jill, what's happening? What's wrong?

dialogue.raw_text: It was him! Somebody call the police! Help me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait a minute! Just hold on! Sweetheart, what was him? What are you talking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That man... Curt Duncan... He's home again! He's got our children!

dialogue.raw_text: Hello?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, Carol, it's Mr. Lockhart. What's going on over there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing's going on.

dialogue.raw_text: Is everything all right?

dialogue.raw_text: Everything's fine. Why? What's --?

dialogue.raw_text: Carol, listen to me very carefully. If there's a man in the house, if there's any reason why you can't talk to me right now, just answer yes to me over the phone. That's all. If there's any danger of any kind, just say yes.

dialogue.raw_text: I don't understand what's happening. What man in the house?

dialogue.raw_text: About forty-five minutes ago. Everything's fine. They were fast asleep.

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Would you go upstairs and, and check on the children for me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure. Hold on.

direction.raw_text: John and Jill pull up in the station wagon followed by a squad car -- no sirens or lights. They all get out and rush for the front door. John pulls out his key to open the door... and discovers that it's unlocked. Cautiously, they step inside.

dialogue.raw_text: (opening her eyes) Mommy?

dialogue.raw_text: Sshhh...

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Nothing was wrong?

direction.raw_text: Pause.

direction.raw_text: John turns and moves over beside her.

dialogue.raw_text: What are you thinking about?

dialogue.raw_text: I know that voice.

direction.raw_text: of Jill. She is shocked.

direction.raw_text: He gets up and walks out of the room talking.

dialogue.raw_text: What are we supposed to do? Leave town? Take the kids and lock ourselves up somewhere? Come on... Let's get a good night's sleep, and in the morning we can rethink this whole thing.

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing has to be rethought. And I'm not about to fall asleep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Try to relax, honey. I'm here. We're both here. The house is locked up. The cops'll be just outside all night long. We're safe now.

dialogue.raw_text: That's what they told me before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay. Look. If it'll make you feel any better...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll keep it right here beside me all night. You know I'm a light sleeper and a damn good shot. Are you satisfied?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: John, I'm sorry to be putting you through all this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, you're not putting me through anything that you don't have to go through yourself. I'm with you all the way. Trust me. Okay?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's my girl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Now try to relax. We'll get some sleep. You'll be surprised how differently things will look in the morning.

dialogue.raw_text: (complaining) Honey...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not so loud. You're going to wake the children.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling) Naw. Those kids'd sleep through an earthquake. They're good kids. (handing her the pills and water) Here, take a couple of these. They're just what the doctor ordered.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) You know, I read somewhere about this psychological thing called hysterical delusion or hysterical recall or something. It had to do with how an event from your past can sneak up on you sometimes and fool you when it's only just a memory. I don't know. We'll talk about it in the morning. Maybe there's someone we can see about that...

direction.raw_text: Jill is tossing in her sleep. John is fast asleep next to her, on his side facing away from her. Then, Jill wakes up. She is heavily sedated, groggy. She hardly knows where she is at first. She pulls herself up to a sitting position on the side of the bed. She tries to gather her wits. Then she gets up and walks slowly out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through the upstairs hallway, down the staircase and toward the kitchen. The darkness around her is ominous, threatening. She stops at the dining room window and looks out. On the street a patrol car slowly passes and disappears down the block.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jill enters, turns on the light, opens a cupboard and takes out a glass. She goes to the refrigerator and opens it. Suddenly, the lights go out. Jill closes the refrigerator door and goes and turns on another light. Apparently, only a lightbulb has blown. Jill unscrews the burned-out bulb from its socket and throws it in the trash. She leaves the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jill walks to a hall closet and opens it. A light comes on inside as she does so. A puzzled, half-startled expression comes onto her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inside the closet, half the hangers with coats, etc., are on the floor. Sound over: A telephone being dialed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clifford has just finished dialing the phone. He waits, nothing happens. Then a strange, siren-like noise comes out of the telephone. Clifford listens, then hangs up. He picks up the .38 he has lying on the desk and idly starts flipping the cartridge chamber with one of his jimmy needles. After a moment, he lays the gun down and picks up the phone again, this time calling the OPERATOR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The operator dials. There is a pause. Then the same strange noise cuts in.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Operator.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can you dial a local number for me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) What is the number, please?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Operator, what does that mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I'm sorry, sir, that line seems to be disconnected.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why don't I get a recording?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I don't know, sir. Maybe the number was just recently disconnected. Maybe there's a temporary malfunction in the wiring. Why don't you try it again in the morning?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, okay. Thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . LOCKHART HOME - UPSTAIRS HALLWAY - NIGHT Jill is walking down the hall to the children's bedroom. She opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Jill quietly enters. The children are asleep. Jill goes to June and tucks her in. Then she walks over to Stevie's bed. He is sleeping, but with a Sugar Daddy in his hand. Jill looks down at him, again puzzled. She leans over, takes the Sugar Daddy and gently wakes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He closes his eyes and is asleep. Jill stands up, turns and starts to walk out of the room. Halfway across the floor, Jill stops. She stands rigid as a thought penetrates her own drowsiness. She turns very slowly and moves to the closet in the children's bedroom. She stands before it a moment. Then she reaches her hand forward for the knob on the closet door. She very slowly pulls the door open. She looks inside. There is nothing. Jill quietly closes the closet door and leaves the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Stevie... Stevie...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stirring, but not fully awake) Yes?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stevie, listen to me. Where did you get this candy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where did you get this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (very groggy) The man gave it to me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What man?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (drifting off) I don't know... He was... Wings on a horse...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Jill enters. John is still asleep facing the wall. Jill gets into bed, sitting up. She is wide awake now. She sits for a moment in the darkness, thinking. Then she reaches for the princess phone on the bedside table. She doesn't get a dial tone. She quietly pushes the phone's disconnect button up and down several times. Still no dial tone. Jill hangs up and thinks for another moment, apprehension creeping over her face. Then, in the darkness of the bedroom, she begins to hear the muttering of a man's voice, low and deep. It is Duncan in the throes of Guy du Marraux. Jill freezes. As the voice gets steadily louder and more menacing, her attention focuses on the door to the bedroom closet which is a couple of inches ajar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She reaches for the bedside lamp and turns it on, never taking her eyes away from the closet door. As soon as the light comes on, the voice stops. Her eyes still riveted to the door, Jill grabs her husband's shoulder and shakes him, her voice cracking with fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The body beside her stirs, rolls over, looks at her hideously. It is Duncan!! Jill shrieks, and makes a move to leap out of the bed. Duncan, the hideous and terrifying sound of his madness grumbling out of his throat, manages to grab the back of her nightgown. As Jill struggles to get off the bed, the gown rips slightly while she fights to get away. Duncan rolls to her side of the bed and manages to grab Jill's ankle while letting go of the gown. It causes Jill to lose her balance and tumble onto the floor just short of the doorway leading out of the room. Duncan is on her in a flash, clutching at her and moving his hands for her throat. Jill screams again. It is the desperate sound of a woman facing certain death. Suddenly, two quick shots ring out, overwhelming all other sound. Duncan falls back with a groan and a thud. Out of the darkness of the hallway steps Clifford, pistol in hand. He crosses to Duncan. He is dead. Then Clifford walks around the room to the far side of the bed and looks down. On the narrow strip of floor between the bed and the wall lies John. Clifford nudges the body with his foot. John stirs, as if he has been knocked unconscious, but it will be some time yet before he comes to. Clifford starts to walk out of the room, stepping over Duncan's body, edging past Jill who is propped up in the doorway, sobbing hysterically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then he is gone. As Jill sits there unable to rein in her emotions, June and Stevie toddle up to her groggily from the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jill clutches her children to her heaving breast and buries her face between them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (urgently whispering) John?... John?...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: John!... John!...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your husband's okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mommy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Looking through the open front doorway into the quiet night beyond.
direction.name: direction
